info.title: Abandoned checkouts
info.description:
You can use the Abandoned checkouts resource to retrieve a list and a count of abandoned checkouts. A checkout is considered abandoned after the customer has added contact information, but before the customer has completed their purchase.

This resource may be helpful to complete the following actions:

  • Gather marketing information on customers who have abandoned their cart.
  • Use information to remarket to abandoned checkout customers.
  • Understand customers’ behavior.
  • Track abandoned checkouts over time.
  • View abandoned checkout items.

paths.description: Retrieves a count of checkouts from the past 90 days

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Count checkouts created before the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Count checkouts created after the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Count checkouts with a given status.

closed.summary: Count only closed abandoned checkouts that have been archived.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Count checkouts last updated before the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Count checkouts last updated after the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

x-examples.name: Count abandoned checkouts created before date specified

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json?created_at_max=2013-10-12T07%3A05%3A27-02%3A00" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
  created_at_max: "2013-10-12T07:05:27-02:00",
)

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json?status=closed" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
  status: "closed",
)

paths.description: Retrieves a list of abandoned checkouts.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of abandoned checkouts

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Show checkouts created before the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Show checkouts created after the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to show.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Show only checkouts with a given status.

closed.summary: Count only closed abandoned checkouts that have been archived.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show checkouts last updated before the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show checkouts last updated after the specified date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

200.description: Retrieves a list of abandoned checkouts

x-examples.name: Retrieve a limited number of abandoned checkouts

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json?limit=1" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
  limit: "1",
)

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve checkouts created before date specified

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json?created_at_max=2013-10-12T07%3A05%3A27-02%3A00" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
  created_at_max: "2013-10-12T07:05:27-02:00",
)

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/checkouts.json?status=closed" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::AbandonedCheckout.checkouts(
  session: test_session,
  status: "closed",
)

properties.description: The recovery URL that's sent to a customer so they can recover their checkout.
properties.name: abandoned_checkout_url

properties.description:
The mailing address associated with the payment method. It has the following properties:
  • address1: The street address of the billing address.
  • address2: An optional additional field for the street address of the billing address.
  • city: The city of the billing address.
  • company: The company of the person associated with the billing address.
  • country: The name of the country of the billing address.
  • country_code: The two-letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format) for the country of the billing address.
  • default: Whether this is the default address for the customer.
  • first_name: The first name of the person associated with the payment method.
  • last_name: The last name of the person associated with the payment method.
  • latitude: The latitude of the billing address.
  • longitude: The longitude of the billing address.
  • name: The full name of the person associated with the payment method.
  • phone: The phone number at the billing address.
  • province: The name of the state or province of the billing address.
  • province_code: The two-letter abbreviation of the state or province of the billing address.
  • zip: The zip or postal code of the billing address.
properties.name: billing_address

properties.description: Whether the customer would like to receive email updates from the shop. This is set by the I want to receive occasional emails about new products, promotions and other news checkbox during checkout.
properties.name: buyer_accepts_marketing

properties.description: Whether the customer would like to receive SMS updates from the shop. This is set by the Text me with news and offers checkbox during checkout.
properties.name: buyer_accepts_sms_marketing

properties.description: The ID for the cart that's attached to the checkout.
properties.name: cart_token

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the checkout was closed. If the checkout was not closed, then this value is null.
properties.name: closed_at

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the checkout was completed. For abandoned checkouts, this value is null until a customer completes the checkout using the recovery URL.
properties.name: completed_at

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the checkout was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) of the shop's default currency at the time of checkout. For the currency that the customer used at checkout, see presentment_currency.
properties.name: currency

properties.description: The customer details associated with the abandoned checkout. For more information, refer to the Customer resource.
properties.name: customer

properties.description: The two or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier. Example values: en, en-CA.
properties.name: customer_locale

properties.description: The ID of the Shopify POS device that created the checkout.
properties.name: device_id

properties.description:
Discount codes applied to the checkout. Returns an empty array when no codes are applied.

Each discount code has the following fields:
  • amount: The amount of the discount in presentment currency.
  • code: The discount code.
  • type: The type of discount. Valid values: percentage, shipping, fixed_amount. (default: fixed_amount)
properties.name: discount_codes

properties.description: The customer's email address.
properties.name: email

properties.description: The payment gateway used by the checkout. For abandoned checkouts, this value is always null.
properties.name: gateway

properties.description: The ID for the checkout.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The URL for the page where the customer entered the shop.
properties.name: landing_site

properties.description:
A list of line items, each containing information about an item in the checkout. Each object has the following properties:
  • fulfillment_service: The fulfillment service provider for the item.
  • fulfillment_status: The status of the item's fulfillment. Valid values: fulfilled, null, partial.
  • grams: The weight of the item in grams.
  • price: The price of the item in presentment currency.
  • product_id: The product ID od the item.
  • quantity: The number of products that were purchased.
  • requires_shipping: Whether the items requires shipping..
  • sku: A unique identifier for the item in the shop.
  • title: The title of the product.
  • variant_id: The product variant ID of item.
  • variant_title: The title of the product variant.
  • vendor: The name of the item's supplier.
properties.name: line_items

properties.description: The ID of the physical location where the checkout was processed.
properties.name: location_id

properties.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the order.
properties.name: note

properties.description: The customer's phone number for receiving SMS notifications.
properties.name: phone

properties.description: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) of the currency that the customer used at checkout. For the shop's default currency, see currency.
properties.name: presentment_currency

properties.description: The website that referred the customer to the shop.
properties.name: referring_site

properties.description:
The mailing address where the order will be shipped to. It has the following properties:
  • address1: The street address of the shipping address.
  • address2: An optional additional field for the street address of the shipping address.
  • city: The city of the shipping address.
  • company: The company of the person associated with the shipping address.
  • country: The name of the country of the shipping address.
  • country_code: The two-letter code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format) for the country of the shipping address.
  • first_name: The first name of the person associated with the shipping address.
  • last_name: The last name of the person associated with the shipping address.
  • latitude: The latitude of the shipping address.
  • longitude: The longitude of the shipping address.
  • name: The full name of the person associated with the shipping address.
  • phone: The phone number at the shipping address.
  • province: The name of the state or province of the shipping address.
  • province_code: The two-letter abbreviation of the state or province of the shipping address.
  • zip: The zip or postal code of the shipping address.
properties.name: shipping_address

properties.description: The phone number used to opt in to SMS marketing during checkout.
properties.name: sms_marketing_phone

properties.description:
Information about the chosen shipping method. It has the following properties:
  • code: A reference to the shipping method.
  • price: The price of the shipping method in presentment currency.
  • source: The channel where the checkout originated. Example value: shopify.
  • title: The title of the shipping method. Example value: International Shipping.
properties.name: shipping_lines

properties.description: Where the checkout originated. Valid values: web, pos, iphone, android.
properties.name: source_name

properties.description: The price of the checkout in presentment currency before shipping and taxes.
properties.name: subtotal_price

properties.description:
An array of tax line objects, each of which details a tax applicable to the checkout. Each object has the following properties:
  • price: The amount of tax to be charged in presentment currency.
  • rate: The rate of tax to be applied.
  • title: The name of the tax.
  • channel_liable: Whether the channel that submitted the tax line is liable for remitting. A value of null indicates unknown liability for the tax line.
properties.name: tax_lines

properties.description: Whether taxes are included in the price.
properties.name: taxes_included

properties.description: A unique ID for a checkout.
properties.name: token

properties.description: The total amount of discounts to be applied in presentment currency.
properties.name: total_discounts

properties.description: The total duties of the checkout in presentment currency.
properties.name: total_duties

properties.description: The sum of the prices of all line items in the checkout in presentment currency.
properties.name: total_line_items_price

properties.description: The sum of line item prices, all discounts, shipping costs, and taxes for the checkout in presentment currency.
properties.name: total_price

properties.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the checkout in presentment currency.
properties.name: total_tax

properties.description: The sum of all the weights in grams of the line items in the checkout.
properties.name: total_weight

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the checkout was last modified.
properties.name: updated_at

properties.description: The ID of the user who created the checkout.
properties.name: user_id

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Retrieve a list of incomplete checkouts. Each Checkout object includes a URL to the online checkout, where the customer can complete their purchase.
